body:
### Welcome to EEGtopo.
![sample](http://kazemakase.github.com/eegtopo/images/samples/grid_2.png)
![sample](http://kazemakase.github.com/eegtopo/images/samples/laplacian.png)
![sample](http://kazemakase.github.com/eegtopo/images/samples/allpos.png)
![sample](http://kazemakase.github.com/eegtopo/images/samples/topo.png)

#### Getting Started

##### Installation

###### Windows
[Download the binary](https://github.com/kazemakase/eegtopo/downloads).

###### Linux
[Build from source](https://github.com/kazemakase/eegtopo/wiki/Building-From-Source).

##### Basic Usage
1. Start up a terminal (or the command line)
2. Change to the location of the binary file
3. For a start, lets create an EEG layout consisting of 5 electrodes around Cz.

```
$ eegtopo -e Fz C3 Cz C4 Pz -o laplacian.pdf
```

This creates a file, laplacian.pdf, that shows schematically the locations of the electrodes Fz, C3, Cz, C4, and Pz.

For more advanced or fine-grained control over your plots, you will need to [create small script files](https://github.com/kazemakase/eegtopo/wiki/Creating-Script-Files) or check out the [command line options](https://github.com/kazemakase/eegtopo/wiki/Command-Line-Usage).
